channel.title: Posts on What I Learned Today
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on What I Learned Today

item.title: Airflow on amazonlinux
item.description: I spent some time yesterday installing Apache Airflow in a Docker container, using an image based on the amazonlinux image provided by Amazon. The end goal is to run it in an EC2 instance, but while I was waiting for the ops team to create one for me, I decided to experiment with setting it up in Docker. Using the amazonlinux image should give me a similar environment to what I can expect on the EC2.

item.title: Static Site Generators
item.description: Today I learned that there are a lot of static site generators out there. It’s apparently something that has gained a lot of interest. I’m mainly interested in generating my content from Markdown files, so at least that gave me somewhere to start when narrowing down the list to try. I’m interested in static site generation after my experience with a Movable Type blog I had at some point, which could publish static html content and as a result loaded really fast.
